info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 2:50AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Susquehanna, northwestern Luzerne, southeastern Bradford and Wyoming Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 248 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Camptown to near Fairmount Springs. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilkes-Barre, Falls, Muhlenberg, Kingston, Nanticoke, Plains, Plymouth, Exeter, Vernon and Swoyersville. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 170A and B and near 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
